definition: to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory

sentences.english: But he tried a third time, was accepted and marched into the history books.
sentences.chinese: 但他做了第三次嘗試，最終被錄取並且名垂青史。

sentences.english: This Battle will be cherished and remembered forever.
It doesn’t always work, but good things often come to those who are persistent.
sentences.chinese: 這並不總是有效，但好事總是垂青那些有恆心的人。

sentences.english: He left a name in history as a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他作爲民族英雄而名垂青史。

sentences.english: While it was Cai Wei`s resolution on the study of ancient Chinese language that let him become appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 而正是蔡偉對於學習古漢字的執着，使他得蒙垂青。

sentences.english: The young lady, a victim of the god's unwanted attention, was going to run away with her lover.
sentences.chinese: 年輕女子，爲了躲避天神的垂青，決心和戀人私奔。

sentences.english: Jesus loves you more than you will know.
Fortune favors the bold, but abandons the timid.
sentences.chinese: 命運從來是拋棄怯懦而垂青勇毅。

sentences.english: At 70, Nazarbayev is eager for a place in history as the father of his country.
sentences.chinese: 70歲的納扎爾巴耶夫期望作爲國家之父而永垂青史。

sentences.english: His landscape painting had been favored Z, Li Jing.
sentences.chinese: 他的山水畫藝術曾得到李璟的垂青。

sentences.english: As Wenger stated, it left his Arsenal 'immortal'.
sentences.chinese: 溫格表示，這會使他的這支阿森納永垂青史。

sentences.english: The nation is experiencing turmoil, the hero is favored by luck .
sentences.chinese: 民族正經歷着動盪，主角正被幸運之神垂青。

sentences.english: Both Adams and Leverrier are honored for discovering Neptune.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯和勒威耶兩人都因發現了海王星而名垂青史。

sentences.english: If be not willing diligent, favors longing.
sentences.chinese: 如蒙垂青，定當勤勉，不負所望。

definition: to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
generous treatment
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to admire
to admire wholeheartedly/to fall in love with
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
(old) (esp. of the Emperor) to show special favor towards
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
chance/opportunity/destiny
one's happy lot/good fortune
to win success and recognition (idiom)
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
